title: A Place Called Winter
description: Three a.m. Carol Ingram stands at the window in her dark apartment. A full moon throws the landscape into bright relief and reveals no lurking shadows. The street is quiet. A moment later, she locks the door, carries a suitcase to her car, and starts the engine. She doesn’t turn on the headlights until she’s a block away. Running from an ex-lover’s savage attack that leaves her physically and emotionally scarred, Carol travels a thousand miles to hide in Winter, an isolated community in Oregon’s Blue Mountain foothills. Amid the remote canyon’s natural beauty where she once spent childhood summers, a new journey begins, one with friends, a job she enjoys, and a growing sense that Winter is where she belongs. But chance events threaten to shatter her fragile hold on the future: the ex-lover finds her, a woman vanishes, an elderly neighbor commits suicide, and then a second woman disappears. Carol realizes no place is safe, no one entirely innocent. She must confront her past and fight for what she believes in or forever pay the price.
author: Judith Quaempts
